ygData.msgSnippet: Do you mean that like for Khanh,  the maven build works fine for you outside Eclipse, but inside Eclipse fails with a error about the jetty-6.0.2 POM? What

Do you mean that like for Khanh,  the maven build works fine for you 
outside Eclipse, but inside Eclipse fails with a error about the 
jetty-6.0.2 POM?

What version of maven do you have installed ('mvn -v') , and what 
version of m2eclipse (Help->Software Updates->Manage Configuration)?

- Gordon @ IA

Ryan Smith wrote:
>   I get this same issue in eclipse 3.3.2,  ubuntu 7.10, m2eclipse plugin
> 
> On Fri, May 9, 2008 at 11:49 AM, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@... 
> <mailto:gojomo@...>> wrote:
> 
>     I'm still unsure of the cause of this problem. However, if youcan maven
>     build Heritrix outside Eclipse, that may be enough.
> 
>     Once a maven-build has brought all necessary 3rd-party JARs to your
>     local maven repository directory, from that point on you can
>     effectively
>     develop in Eclipse, and launch a working crawler locally, without any
>     further maven builds.
> 
>     I've just corrected a few inaccuracies at this wiki page...
> 
>     http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Setting+up+the+new+Heritrix+in+Eclipse
> 
>     ..about how to launch Heritrix inside Eclipse.
> 
>     FYI, on the Ubunutu machine where I have maven inside Eclipse working,
>     I'm using Maven 2.0.9, Eclipse 3.3.0, and the m2eclipse plugin (which
>     appears in the 'Manage Configuration' dialog as 'Maven 2.0 Integration
>     0.0.11').
> 
>     - Gordon @ IA
> 
>     Khanh Nguyen wrote:
>      > I am on Ubuntu 8.01, Java 6.0, maven2.
>      >
>      > When I tried "mvn install" from command line in /heritrix/dist, it
>      > built fine
>      >
>      > ---------------------------------------------------------
>      > [INFO]
>      > ----------------------------------------------------------
>      > [INFO] BUILD SUCCESSFUL
>      > [INFO]
>      > ----------------------------------------------------------
>      > [INFO] Total time: 40 seconds
>      > [INFO] Finished at: Wed May 07 19:50:35 GMT 2008
>      > [INFO] Final Memory: 13M/26M
>      > [INFO]
>      > ----------------------------------------------------------
>      >
>      > , but when I try to build heritrix in eclipse using maven plug-in
>      > (Right click on pom.xml, "run as"/"maven install"), the result is
>      >
>      > ---------------------------------------------------------
>      > url = http://www.agilejava.com/maven
>      > Downloading:
>      > http://www.agilejava.com/maven/jetty/jetty/6.0.2/jetty-6.0.2.pom
>      > url = http://repo1.maven.org/maven2
>      > Downloading:
>      > http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/jetty/jetty/6.0.2/jetty-6.0.2.pom

>      >
>      > The following mojo encountered an error while executing:
>      > Group-Id: org.apache.maven.plugins
>      > Artifact-Id: maven-assembly-plugin
>      > Version: 2.2-beta-1

>      > brought in via: POM

>      > While building project:

>      > From file: /home/knguyen/workspace/heritrix/dist/pom.xml

>      > not found in repository: Unable to download the artifact from any

>      > internetarchive (http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2),

>      > [INFO]

>      > [INFO] Finished at: Wed May 07 19:51:18 GMT 2008
>      > [INFO] Final Memory: 3M/63M
>      > [INFO]
>      > ----------------------------------------------------------
>      > ---------------------------------------------------------
>      >
>      >
>      > maybe the command line maven and the plug-in maven work differently?
>      >
>      > Thanks,
>      >
>      > -k
